data.title: There Were Thirteen (1931)
data.meta_description: This is the Spanish-language version, with a different cast and crew, of the Charlie Chan film Charlie Chan Carries On, in which Charlie sets out to discover the killer of an American found dead in a London hotel room.
data.text:
Eran trece aka There Were Thirteen is the Spanish language version of Charlie Chan Carries On with a different cast, crew and minor plot alterations. However, they used the same sets like the English version film. This movie has become relevant since the English version film is considered lost and we are not able to watch Warner Oland's first film as Charlie Chan. Manuel Arbó plays Charlie Chan in this version. His interpretation of Chan is not overly offensive so that was easy to overlook.

Although this is a Charlie Chan film, Chan doesn't appear until the last third of the film. A US tourist, part of a travel group going around the world, is killed in London. Then the…

Aka - Eran Trece

This is an interesting oddity. A Charlie Chan film in Spanish. It was made by Fox at the same time as Charlie Chan Carries On starring Warner Oland. In fact, that was Oland's first Charlie Chan film but it is considered a lost film. But from what I have read it is almost exactly the same film - just with different actors. This one is directed by a fellow named David Howard, who went on to direct a number of B Westerns but before this he made seven Spanish language films for Fox. He was born in Philadelphia but perhaps he spoke Spanish and got tagged with these Spanish films. Some at least seem to have…
